description: (T1) - American Pin Oak (Quercus palustria) - rear garden -reduce entire crown by 25-30% (2.5-3m from tips) to suitable growth points -reduce lateral branch length to match, shape, balance and tidy -reduce  length of branch overhanging garden at rear, retain selected branch overhanging No.12 LH garden-be directed by client(T2)-Evergreeen Magnolia (M.grandiflora) - rear garden - reduce crown by 25% (1m) to suitable growth points-reduce lateral branch lengths to match, shape, balance and tidy(T3) -Crab Apple (Malus sylvestris)- rear garden - bracket fungus observed -reduce crown by 25% (0,5m) to suitable growth points-remove any dead wood branches(T4) -Cotoneaster (C.frigidus) - rear garden - reduce new growth branches to main crown line -prune back lateral inbound branches to within extension gutter line-thin crown to allow more light(T5) -Magnolia(M.stellata) - front garden  -lightly prune to shape and tidy -remove all deadwood branches
borough: London Borough of Hammersmith and Fulham
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
